question: And how important is it to encourage children to take up hobbies?
transcript: It great I think it so good to motivate children to take up hobbies for themselves That how they can use their free time instead of just wandering around watching TV or just playing with their phones it can be great it can be a good experience and they can learn some new skills too I mean even if their hobby is to just draw something simple they can learn some useful skills too Like organizing like setting up their mind like choosing a goal and reaching it So I think it can be useful in their daily life too. Great.

question: And do you think it is also important for older people, like retired people, to take up maybe a few hobbies?
transcript: Yes, obviously. Hobbies, as I said before, can help you relax and enjoy your free time. It can also be useful to take your mind off some of the problems that you might have, work problems, personal problems, And you can just enjoy what you are doing and have fun, as long as you want and you can. So it can be a great idea to have hobbies no matter how old are you or, how many problems you have in your life.

It can also be useful to take your mind off some of the problems that you might have, work problems, personal problems, And you can just enjoy what you are doing and have fun, as long as you want and you can. question: Why do people do charity for others?
transcript: I think people do charity for others because it is part of the empathetic side of the human heart. To just, see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.
transcript_cleaned: I think people do charity for others because it is part of the empathetic side of the human heart. To just, see the needs in other people and just help them out with that because everybody struggles.

grammar_reason: Observation: Error free. Impact: Clear. Justification: **Wide range** meets Band 8.

question: And do you think charity work is a selfish thing to do?
transcript: It depends of the intentions of the person that does it because some people generally, help without expecting anything in return. But there is other people that expect some recognition or just to feel like they are, good people for doing small actions.
transcript_cleaned: It depends of the intentions of the person that does it because some people generally, help without expecting anything in return. But there is other people that expect some recognition or just to feel like they are, good people for doing small actions.

grammar_reason: Observation: 'Depends of', 'there is people'. Impact: Noticeable. Justification: **Mix of simple/complex** meets Band 6.

question: Should charities be allowed to make a profit?

question: Do you think people are less committed to goals now than in the past?
transcript: I think it depends on the people you are looking at. generally we are a bit less pressured, I would say, than our parents or even grandparents because they were really, you know, committed, in order to have jobs, in order to have opportunities. So I think that nowadays some people tend to, yeah, not really complete and fulfill their promises. But others are also seeing promises as a way to, you know, become entrepreneurs and to create new opportunities for themselves. So I guess it is half-half. Okay.

question: And what is the importance of commitment at work?

question: And how can we teach young children to be committed to their goals and never give up?
transcript: I guess, it starts at a young age. We need to basically share with them those values. Because some people sometimes were not told about them. so having, for example, at school, this frame in which young kids can learn that being committed in the end is worth it. Because usually people, they are not committed enough because they think it will not work in the end. But if you show them that no matter what happens, it is worth it, then they will tend to be more committed in the end.
